unnormalised: Delhi reported a surge in dengue cases this week, with numbers reaching 500+, according to data released by the MCD on 16/10/2024. Health officials are concerned as this is a significant increase compared to the same period last yr, where only 250 cases were recorded. Dr. Kumar, the city's health minister, urged residents to take preventive measures.
normalised: Delhi reported a surge in dengue cases this week, with numbers reaching five hundred plus, according to data released by the M-C-D on sixteenth october two thousand and twenty four. Health officials are concerned as this is a significant increase compared to the same period last year, where only two hundred and fifty cases were recorded. Doctor Kumar, the city's health minister, urged residents to take preventive measures.

unnormalised: The Health Dept has launched a campaign focused on eliminating mosquito breeding sites. Teams are visiting residential areas, especially in densely populated zones like Seelampur & Sadar Bazaar, to raise awareness. They are also fogging these areas regularly. Free dengue testing camps have been set up at various locations including AIIMS and RML Hospital.
normalised: The Health Department has launched a campaign focused on eliminating mosquito breeding sites. Teams are visiting residential areas, especially in densely populated zones like Seelampur and Sadar Bazaar, to raise awareness. They are also fogging these areas regularly. Free dengue testing camps have been set up at various locations including A-I-I-M-S and R-M-L Hospital.

unnormalised: Public health experts advise using mosquito repellents, wearing long sleeves, and emptying stagnant water from containers. They stress that early diagnosis is key to managing the disease effectively. People experiencing symptoms such as high fever, headache, and joint pain should consult a Dr. immediately. Helpline number 1075 is available for any query.
normalised: Public health experts advise using mosquito repellents, wearing long sleeves, and emptying stagnant water from containers. They stress that early diagnosis is key to managing the disease effectively. People experiencing symptoms such as high fever, headache, and joint pain should consult a Doctor immediately. Helpline number one zero seven five is available for any query.
